Name: UCSB
Description: A great university located along the California Coast!

Name: The Secret Forest Station
Description: Active ecological study site on the south bank of the Tambopata River, in one of the worlds largest biodiversity hotspots.

Name: Waikamoi Preserve
Description: One of the most pristine native wet forests in Hawai'i, where many endangered native birds can still be found

Name: Hemming Bay
Description: A private property on East Thurlow Island, which harbors old growth forest, undisturbed streams, and pristine habitat

Name: Fort Point
Description: An idyllic and dangerous surf spot on the south side of the Golden Gate, which can provide some of the best waves in the area (under proper conditions)

Name: Ramanote Canyon
Description: An ecological continuation of Mexico (although politically considered the US), Ramanote Canyon contains wildlife most would associate with the neotropics, such as Jaguars, Elegant Trogons, Ocelots, Vine Snakes, and more.
